channel.title: Democracy Now! Video
channel.description: A daily radio and TV program on over 350 stations, pioneering the largest community media collaboration in the U.S., offered in MPEG4 video format.
channel.itunes:author: Amy Goodman

item.title: Democracy Now! - Wednesday, September 06, 2006
item.description: Headlines for September 6, 2006; Mexico Court Declares Calderon Winner of Disputed Election, Lopez Obrador Vows to Form Parallel Gov't; Father Recounts Burning Marine Van and Himself After Learning of Son's Death in Iraq; Robert Fisk on Lebanon: "The Ceasefire Can't Work"

item.title: Democracy Now! - Thursday, August 31, 2006
item.description: Headlines for August 31, 2006; Shocking Lancet Study: 8,000 Murders, 35,000 Rapes and Sexual Assaults in Haiti During U.S.-Backed Coup Regime After Aristide Ouster; Eyewitnesses Account: UN Forces Open Fire on Poor Haitian Neighborhood; Women Recount Gang Rape, Abuse at Hearing Against Haitian Death Squad Leader Emmanuel Constant; Public Outcry Forces Ohio to Delay Destruction of Presidential Ballots; "I Am Not Willing To Kill Or Be Killed For Something I Don't Believe In" - AWOL Soldier Refuses to Return to Iraq

item.title: Democracy Now! - Wednesday, August 30, 2006
item.description: Headlines for August 30, 2006; Congressmember Murtha: "I'm Disappointed" by Hillary Clinton's Refusal to Endorse Troop Withdrawal Plan; Congressmember Weiner Gets It Wrong On Palestinian Group He Tried To Bar From U.S.; Lebanon Considers Suing Israel for War Crimes; "We Don't Want War" - Leading Iranian Dissident and Former Political Prisoner Akbar Ganji

item.title: Democracy Now! - Tuesday, August 29, 2006
item.description: Headlines for August 29, 2006; Hurricane Katrina, One Year Later: Democracy Now! Looks Back to the Days After the Disaster; Breach of Faith: Times-Picayune Editor Jed Horne on "Neoconservative" Ray Nagin and "Federal Oppression" in the South; One Year After Katrina, New Orleans Public Housing Projects Remain Closed; New Orleans Judge Slated to Release Prisoners Citing Breakdown in Criminal Justice System

item.title: Democracy Now! - Monday, August 28, 2006
item.description: Headlines for August 28, 2006; Top Hurricane Expert Says Officials Threatened His Job Over Pre-Katrina Warnings; For Whom is New Orleans Being Rebuilt? City Demographics Radically Altered With Many Black Residents Still Unable to Return; Common Ground Collective Continues to Bring Thousands of Volunteers From Around the World to Gulf Coast For Post-Katrina Relief Efforts; Lebanese MP Ghassan Moukheiber on the Future of Lebanon Politics, Hezbollah and the Ongoing Israeli Occupation
